cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.CL, cs.SD

Reasoning: The paper discusses the problem of false information on the Web and its impact on public opinion, especially in the context of political events. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including social networks (cs.SI), cybersecurity (cs.CY), cryptography (cs.CR), natural language processing (cs.CL), and software engineering (cs.SD). The paper provides a typology of the false-information ecosystem and reviews existing research on the topic, which suggests a multidisciplinary approach to addressing the problem. Therefore, it is likely to be relevant to researchers in these sub-fields.
